prompt:
I have the following gene expression data, "leukemiaExp.txt". The file is tab separated. The table has gene names on the first column. Each row is a gene and each column is a distinct sample. Filter genes based on their variability so we retain the most variable top 1000 genes. Based on these variable genes, plot a heatmap with clustering. Also plot PCA for samples.

response:
```
# Read the gene expression data from the file
data <- read.table("leukemiaExp.txt", sep="\t", header=TRUE, row.names=1)

# Calculate the variance of each gene
variances <- apply(data, 1, var)

# Order genes based on their variance
ordered_genes <- names(variances)[order(variances, decreasing=TRUE)]

# Select the top 1000 most variable genes
selected_genes <- ordered_genes[1:1000]

# Filter the data to retain only the selected genes
filtered_data <- data[selected_genes, ]

# Calculate the distance matrix using euclidean distance
distance_matrix <- dist(filtered_data)

# Perform hierarchical clustering on the distance matrix
hc <- hclust(distance_matrix)

# Create a heatmap with clustering
heatmap(filtered_data, col=heat.colors(256), scale="row",
        main="Gene Expression Heatmap")

# Perform PCA on the filtered data
pca <- prcomp(filtered_data)

# Plot the PCA
plot(pca$x, col=as.numeric(as.factor(colnames(filtered_data))),
     pch=16, xlab="PC1", ylab="PC2", main="PCA Plot")
```
